subject: Law
title: National Parks and Public Lands
description: One-minute skill: National Parks and Public Lands.

hook.text: The US owns 640 million acresâ€”28% of the country. Who decides how it's used: conservation or extraction?

buildup.text: Public lands are managed under multiple-use mandates balancing recreation, conservation, grazing, and extraction.

discovery.text: The National Park Service preserves. The Forest Service manages. The BLM balances multiple uses on vast western lands.

twist.text: Presidents can create national monuments under the Antiquities Act. But can they shrink them? Courts are still deciding.

climax.text: Debates over drilling, mining, and grazing on public land pit economic interests against conservation goals constantly.

punchline.text: Public land belongs to everyone. Managing it fairly is the endless challenge.

quiz.question: What does the Antiquities Act allow presidents to do?
